New Records: India scored 171 runs in 7 overs, the highest score by any team in the match; Rohit Sharma scored 57 runs, the highest individual score for India; Suryakumar Yadav scored 47 runs, the second-highest for India; England scored 103 runs in 10 overs, their lowest score in the tournament; Jofra Archer took 1 wicket for England; India's spinners took 6 wickets in total; Kuldeep Yadav took 3 wickets for India
Key Match Events: India's spinners dominated England's batting line-up; Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav formed a crucial 73-run partnership; England's batting order struggled against India's spinners; Kuldeep Yadav took a crucial wicket of Jonny Bairstow with his first ball; Axar Patel took 3 wickets in his first 3 overs; England's lower-order batters were dismissed in a mix-up; India won by a margin of 68 runs
Pre-Game Insights: The match was played on a slow, low-bounce pitch in Guyana; England had a tough time scoring runs; India's batters showed flexibility in adjusting their approach; Rohit Sharma was aggressive early on before settling in; England's spinners were expected to play a key role but struggled initially
Post-Match Reflections: India's coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their World Cup campaign; Rohit Sharma praised the team's resilience; ESPNcricinfo's report called it a clinical performance by India; England's defeat ended their reign as champions
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Providence Stadium; India's spinners were well-prepared for the spin-friendly pitch; the match was part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024; the result kept India's hopes alive for the final
